meanings.definition: Breed (an animal) with one not of the same strain or family.
meanings.sent1: The farmer outcrossed his cows with a different breed to improve their health.
meanings.sent2: She decided to outcross her dog with a purebred to get unique puppies.
meanings.sent3: The cat outcrossed with a raccoon, creating a funny-looking hybrid.
meanings.sent4: His ideas outcrossed traditional boundaries, leading to innovative solutions.
meanings.sent5: The garden outcrossed with wildflowers, creating a beautiful mix of colors.

meanings.definition: To mate (an animal) with one not of the same strain or family.
meanings.sent1: The zookeeper outcrossed the lions to introduce new genes into the population.
meanings.sent2: In the wild, animals often outcross to ensure genetic diversity.
meanings.sent3: The penguin outcrossed with a seagull, resulting in a confused offspring.
meanings.sent4: Their friendship outcrossed cultural barriers, enriching their lives.
meanings.sent5: The rivers outcrossed in a magnificent confluence of waters.
